entry.title: Veteran overcomes brain injury to obtain master's degree
entry.summary:
SPOKANE, Wash. — Chris Carver spent weeks in a coma after encountering an improvised explosive device in Iraq. Doctors gave him little chance of survival; the U.S. Army flew his wife and parents to Germany to say goodbye.

more
entry.content:
SPOKANE, Wash. — Chris Carver spent weeks in a coma after encountering an improvised explosive device in Iraq. Doctors gave him little chance of survival; the U.S. Army flew his wife and parents to Germany to say goodbye.

entry.title: Virtual Student Foreign Service (VSFS) eInternship
entry.summary: The Virtual Student Foreign Service (VSFS) is an academic year-long, unpaid eInternship program. VSFS virtually connects U.S. citizen college students with State Department, U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), Foreign Commercial Service, Foreign Agriculture Service, Broadcasting Board of Governors, and other US government agency domestic offices more
entry.content:
The Virtual Student Foreign Service (VSFS) is an academic year-long, unpaid eInternship program. VSFS virtually connects U.S. citizen college students with State Department, U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), Foreign Commercial Service, Foreign Agriculture Service, Broadcasting Board of Governors, and other US government agency domestic offices

Read Full Post
entry.DisplayTitle: Virtual Student Foreign Service (VSFS) eInternship

entry.title: HOT JOB ALERT! Federal Aviation Administration
entry.summary:
HOT JOB ALERT! The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) is launching a nationwide engineering technician recruitment and outreach program. The agency will be recruiting for 65 Locations, hiring a total of 102 employees. Applicants must be willing to relocate

more

entry.title: Justice Is Fast-Tracking Cyber Hires
entry.summary: The Justice Department is recruiting cyber professionals under special rules to fill vacancies more quickly now that funding constraints have eased somewhat, the department's top network security official said. While the severity of hacks is increasing, civilian agencies still struggle to bring capable computer programmers on staff. more
entry.content:
The Justice Department is recruiting cyber professionals under special rules to fill vacancies more quickly now that funding constraints have eased somewhat, the department's top network security official said. While the severity of hacks is increasing, civilian agencies still struggle to bring capable computer programmers on staff.

Read Full Post
entry.DisplayTitle: Justice Is Fast-Tracking Cyber Hires

entry.title: Community Planning and Development Opportunities with HUD!
entry.summary: HOT JOB ALERT!  The U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development is seeking veterans eligible for non-competitive hiring authority in the Federal government to fill multiple Community Planning and Development Representatives, GS-301-09, positions.  These positions have a full performance level of GS-12. more

entry.title: Honor Fallen Heroes this Memorial Day
entry.summary: Director Katherine Archuleta OPM: As we get ready to commemorate Memorial Day weekend and enjoy the first outdoor celebration of the season, I hope all of us will take a moment to reflect on the meaning of this holiday: to remember the brave men and women who gave their lives in service to the United States as members of the armed forces. more
entry.content:
Director Katherine Archuleta OPM: As we get ready to commemorate Memorial Day weekend and enjoy the first outdoor celebration of the season, I hope all of us will take a moment to reflect on the meaning of this holiday: to remember the brave men and women who gave their lives in service to the United States as members of the armed forces.

Read Full Post
entry.DisplayTitle: Honor Fallen Heroes this Memorial Day

entry.title: 'Vetrepreneurs' should look to Internet to raise capital

entry.title: Army vet gets back to work
entry.summary: Bernard Hill retired from the military at a young age, but soon found he wanted to get back into the workforce. The 48-year-old retired from the U.S. Army in November after 28 years of service. more

entry.title: The LEAD Certificate Program
entry.summary: If you are already a Federal employee, LEAD offers "must have" leadership skills and provides inter-agency experience that puts you squarely on the path to career advancement. If you are a veteran, LEAD helps build skills to transition from a military career to a civilian career. more
entry.content:
If you are already a Federal employee, LEAD offers "must have" leadership skills and provides inter-agency experience that puts you squarely on the path to career advancement. If you are a veteran, LEAD helps build skills to transition from a military career to a civilian career.
